Description: Shoulder and body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery oinochoe; white slip; exterior, from top: on shoulder, possibly goat's hoof and rising roundel as filling ornament; wide black band; frieze of goats grazing to right (neck, head and one foreleg of one goat and one hind leg of second goat remaining); rising roundel, dotted cross, dotted rosette and swastika as filling ornament; below, narrow black band above back and part of rump of goat to right.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Aphrodite Bowl
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Lemos describes the sherd belonging to the Group of the Aphrodite Bowl because the sherd displays a greater amount of variety in the filling ornaments, similar to those on the Aphrodite Bowl. The sherd is also published in Gardner, E. A., Catalogue of the Greek vases in the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. Cambridge 1897, 90.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 34, no. 31, pl. XVII)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 75, p. 249, no. 344, pl. 50)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0054) (phase 2)
